evm$mark

Overrides:
evm$mark in class Inhabitant
main 
 public static void main(String args[])
One can use a StandardVat as the direct target of a Java invocation. Its main merely instantiates a StandardVat, and tells it to run its first argument, as a class loaded through the vat's default Class Loader (that is, itself!) with privelegedMain called on it. The other arguments become arguments to the loaded class's main.

makeVat 
 public static Vat_D makeVat(long watchdogMillis,
                             long randomSeed)
Make a new StandardVat. Return a deflector (to a Root) for it, since the "outside world" is not allowed to point directly at the StandardVat.

Parameters:
watchdogMillis - the initial watchdog timeout, or -1 for a watchdog that never barks
randomSeed - the initial random number generator seed
Returns:
a Vat deflector representing the Vat
evm$queue 
 public void evm$queue(Runnable runnable)
This is what's called by the various forms of invoke() and queue().

Parameters:
runnable - the Runnable to queue up for execution

evm$getCurrentVat 
 public static StandardVat evm$getCurrentVat()
Get the current vat. This is used by methods that need to know the current vat but have no other easy way to get at it. This method is likely less efficient than more direct ways as it relies on the thread system.

Returns:
the current vat, or null if the current thread isn't in fact running in a vat
nameLeaf 
 public void nameLeaf(String name,
                      Leaf leaf)
Introduce a new sturdy Leaf to the vat, with the given name. A vat client must use this method to introduce all sturdy leaves so that the vat may properly checkpoint sturdy leaf information. BUG--should be part of the ec.evm.Vat interface.

Parameters:
name - the name of the leaf
leaf - the leaf in question
